content: Your personality and mind matter more than your appearance. What also matters is your health. Some of us care about your health whether you perceive that as hostility or not, it is genuine concern. Health does not define itself by appearance. However, we cannot allow people to re-define health by appearance either. These are very important nuances. Basic nutritional or fitness research informs us that weight is not the metric health is measured by. Some metrics that matter are nutrients, caloric intake, and the ratio of bodyfat to lean muscle. Appearance does not factor into these as much as some think. Any discussion on how humans see body shapes and sizes is superficial unless we are discussing internal health.
